content:
The Czech Centre in London is organizing the AI Science Café Series, which will host researchers Michal Pěchouček, Tomáš Krajník and Michal Čáp from the Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Jan Šedivý from CIIRC and former CTU visiting professor Jonathan Ledgard from january to may. Read more at:
https://aktualne.cvut.cz/en/news/20200116-five-ctu-scientists-will-present-at-the-ai-science-cafe-series-organized-by-the-czech

Thanks to Dr. Libor Přeučil, Head of the Intelligent and Mobile Robotics Laboratory at CIIRC CTU the International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems (IROS) 2021 will be held in Prague. Dr. Přeučil was recently awarded for bringing this event to the Czech Republic. Read more at:
https://www.ciirc.cvut.cz/ambassadors-bolster-technological-leap/

One of the speakers of the online conference Umělá inteligence 2020 is Jan Šedivý from CIIRC CTU, a leader of Alquist team, who will be speaking about the development of award winning chatbot Alquist, which works on the basis of machine learning.

:point_right: Registration for free

:time: May 19, 2020 from 9:00 AM

See full list of speakers, program and more at (Czech only):
https://www.tuesday.cz/akce/umela-inteligence/program/

Online konference: Umělá inteligence 2020
Online konference: Umělá inteligence 2020
